thread.title: SA Severe thunderstorm advice issued at 3:24pm CDT
thread.title_full: SA Severe thunderstorm advice issued at 3:24pm CDT

title: SA Severe thunderstorm advice issued at 3:24pm CDT
text: Weather Warnings - Severe Thunderstorm Warning Australian   MeteorologySouth Australia Regional OfficeTOP PRIORITY FOR IMMEDIATE BROADCASTSEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNINGUpper South East and parts of the Mount Lofty Ranges districts.Issued at 3:24 pm Monday, 20 March 2017.Severe thunderstorms are likely to produce heavy rainfall that may lead to flashflooding in the warning area over the next several hours. Locations which may beaffected include Murray Bridge, Meningie, Bordertown, Karoonda, Keith andCoonalpyn.The State Emergency Service advises that people should: * Don't drive, ride or walk through flood water. * Keep clear of creeks and storm drains. * Stay indoors, away from windows, while storms are nearby. The next warning is due to be issued by 6:25 pm.If severe thunderstorms develop in the Adelaide Region, a more detailed SevereThunderstorm Warning will be issued to people in this area.Warnings are also available through TV and Radio broadcasts, the Bureau'swebsite at www.bom.gov.au or call 1300 659 215. The Bureau and State EmergencyService would appreciate warnings being broadcast regularly. Go!
